title: Equation of motion for oscillating block

content.description: A block of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is on a rough horizontal surface and is attached to a spring with spring constant <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the surface and the block is <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. When the block is at position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the spring is at its unstretched length. The block is pulled to position <math alttext="x equals positive x sub 0" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown above, and released from rest. The block then travels to the left and passes through <math alttext="x equals 0 " overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> before coming momentarily to rest at position <math alttext="x equals the fraction negative x sub 0 over 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is a differential equation that could be used to solve for the block’s position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when it is moving to the left?

choices.label: <math alttext="m times the second derivative of x with respect to t, equals k x plus mu m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>μ</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m times the second derivative of x with respect to t, equals k x minus mu m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m times the second derivative of x with respect to t, equals negative k x plus mu m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>μ</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
